# Simple Routing

Welcome to Lecture 61! Here is a brief class breakdown.

## Learning Objectives

1. Explore front-end routing with React/Flux

## Game Plan

Here's our game plan:

### Final Projects

You should be working on final projects already. I will be looking at your github repos and I **expect** to see commits indicating progress.

Also - **reach out to me** with questions / for guidance. I've been doing a lot of outreach to people tryna get them to schedule meetings with me, I shouldn't have to work this hard for what is ultimately **your** responsibility. 

### Alarm Clock Implementation

Consider **[this repo](https://github.com/mottaquikarim/nycda_react_starter/tree/lecture60/alarm)**. It is a fully working implementation of the alarm clock we discussed on Sunday. 

Look through the code and explain to your table **what** the code does + **how** it works. Feel free to add debug statements in the code to understand what it does. 

### Routing Implementation

Consider **[this repo](https://github.com/mottaquikarim/nycda_react_starter/tree/lecture60/routes/alarm)**. It is a refactored implementation of the alarm clock app from above, but now with routes.

Look through the code and explain to your table **what** the code does + **how** it works. Feel free to add debug statements in the code to understand what it does. 

### Add Edit/ route

Update the code from above to include a new route: **/edit/:id** which will allow user to edit the time and name for an alarm.
